sentences.sentence: Iran has confirmed the death of a Revolutionary Guard commander and his deputy following an Israeli strike on Damascus.

sentences.sentence: The Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said at least five people were killed in the missile attack which struck while officials from groups backed by Iran were reportedly holding a meeting the strike comes as tensions in the region are widening as Israel continues its assault on Gaza its relentless bombing campaign has killed nearly 25,000 Palestinians according to the health authorities there over the past few weeks Israel has been trading rocket fire with Syria and Lebanon along their shared borders and that's fuelling fears that the conflict could spread.

sentences.sentence: If true, it will raise Western concerns that the technology for Iran's ballistic missiles have also been improved.

sentences.sentence: While intense fighting continues in Kan Yunis, southern Gaza, the Palestinian Red Crescent has accused Israel of attacking the Al-Amal Hospital, one of the few medical facilities still operating in Gaza.

sentences.sentence: They've been occurring almost daily, forcing shipping to take the longer route around Africa. The Houthis insist that they only attack ships quote linked to Israel, although it's clear they are targeting others too.

sentences.sentence: The Danish government has urged Nordic Waste to clean up after a massive landslide at its reprocessing plant for contaminated soil.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But since the company controversially declared itself bankrupt, the taxpayer will now have to pay 27 million euros to clean it up.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The landslide near the second biggest city, Aarhus, means six million tonnes of contaminated soil are threatening to poison nearby seas, streams and fjords.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Denmark's sixth richest person, Torben Ostergaard Nielse, owns the company.
